text:

This semester weâ€™ll analyze and visualize real-world data

text:
ğŸ’¾ Installing R and RStudio (More Details)

Or go directly to: posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop
Step 1: Install R
Step 2: Then install RStudio

ğŸ” Which version to choose?

If youâ€™re using Mac:

If your chip is M1, M2, M3, or M4 â†’ use the first link (arm64)
Otherwise â†’ use the second link (Intel, x86_64)

If youâ€™re using Windows:

Click on the first one labeled â€˜baseâ€™

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
section: â˜ï¸ If You Canâ€™t Install: Use RStudio Cloud
text:
â˜ï¸ If You Canâ€™t Install: Use RStudio Cloud

Go to posit.cloud
You can login with your Google account
Click New Project â†’ RStudio Project
RStudio will open in your web browser, no installation needed!

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
ğŸ¨ Customising RStudio Appearance

I personally love the dark theme!
You can change the look of RStudio:

Go to Tools > Global Options > Appearance
Pick a theme you like
Click Apply

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
ğŸªŸ RStudio Panes Overview

Console (Bottom Left) â†’ Run and test code
Script Editor (Top Left) â†’ Write and save your code
Environment/History (Top Right) â†’ See stored variables and past commands
Files/Plots/Packages/Help (Bottom Right) â†’ View plots, install packages, get help

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
âŒ¨ï¸ Running Code in RStudio

To run a line of code from the script:

Mac: Command + Enter
Windows: Ctrl + Enter
